  • Proverbs 31
1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool. 2 As the wandering sparrow, as the flying swallow, so the curse that is causeless shall come home. 3 A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the back of fools. 4 Answer not a fool according to her folly, lest thou also be like unto her. 5 Answer a fool according to her folly, lest she be wise in her own eyes. 6 She that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off her own feet, and drinketh damage. 7 The legs hang limp from the lame; so is a parable in the mouth of fools. 8 As a small stone in a heap of stones, so is she that giveth honour to a fool. 9 As a thorn that cometh into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools. 10 A master performeth all things; but she that stoppeth a fool is as one that stoppeth a flood. 11 As a dog that returneth to her vomit, so is a fool that repeateth her folly. 12 Seest thou a woman wise in her own eyes? there is more hope of a fool than of her. 13 The sluggard saith: 'There is a lion in the way; yea, a lion is in the streets.' 14 The door is turning upon its hinges, and the sluggard is still upon her bed.
15 The sluggard burieth her hand in the dish; it wearieth her to bring it back to her mouth. 16 The sluggard is wiser in her own eyes than seven women that give wise answer. 17 She that passeth by, and meddleth with strife not her own, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears. 18 As a madman who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death; 19 So is the woman that deceiveth her neighbour, and saith: 'Am not I in sport?' 20 Where no wood is, the fire goeth out; and where there is no whisperer, contention ceaseth. 21 As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious woman to kindle strife.

 22 The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels, and they go down into the innermost parts of the body. 23 Burning lips and a wicked heart are like an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross. 24 She that hateth dissembleth with her lips, but she layeth up deceit within her. 25 When she speaketh fair, believe her not; for there are seven abominations in her heart. 26 Though her hatred be concealed with deceit, her wickedness shall be revealed before the congregation. 27 Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein; and she that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon her. 28 A lying tongue hateth those that are crushed by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
